demo of the FileSystem implementation\n */\npublic class FileSystemDemo {\n \n private final FileSystem fs;\n private final Scanner scanner;\n \n public FileSystemDemo() {\n this.fs = new FileSystem();\n this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n }\n \n public void run() {\n System.out.println(\"=\".repeat(60));\n System.out.println(\"File System Demo - Interactive Shell\");\n System.out.println(\"=\".repeat(60));\n System.out.println(\"Type 'help' for available commands, 'exit' to quit\\n\");\n \n while (true) {\n System.out.print(fs.getCurrentWorkingDirectory() + \" $ \");\n String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n \n if (input.isEmpty()) {\n continue;\n }\n \n String[] parts = input.split(\"\\\\s+\", 2);\n String command = parts[0].toLowerCase();\n String args = parts.length > 1 ? parts[1] : \"\";\n \n try {\n if (command.equals(\"exit\") || command.equals(\"quit\")) {\n System.out.println(\"Goodbye!\");\n break;\n } else if (command.equals(\"help\")) {\n printHelp();\n } else {\n executeCommand(command, args);\n }\n } catch (Exception e) {\n System.err.println(\"Error: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n \n scanner.close();\n }\n \n private void executeCommand(String command, String args) {\n switch (command) {\n case \"mkdir\":\n handleMkdir(args);\n break;\n case \"touch\":\n handleTouch(args);\n break;\n case \"ls\":\n handleLs(args);\n break;\n case \"ll\":\n handleLl(args);\n break;\n case \"cat\":\n handleCat(args);\n break;\n case \"echo\":\n handleEcho(args);\n break;\n case \"write\":\n handleWrite(args);\n break;\n case \"append\":\n handleAppend(args);\n break;\n case \"mv\":\n handleMv(args);\n break;\n case \"rm\":\n handleRm(args);\n break;\n case \"cd\":\n handleCd(args);\n break;\n case \"pwd\":\n handlePwd();\n break;\n case \"stat\":\n handleStat(args);\n break;\n case \"chmod\":\n handleChmod(args);\n break;\n case \"tree\":\n handleTree(args);\n break;\n case \"du\":\n handleDu(args);\n break;\n default:\n System.out.println(\"Unknown command: \" + command);\n System.out.println(\"Type 'help' for available commands\");\n }\n }\n \n private void handleMkdir(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: mkdir <path> [-p]\");\n return;\n }\n \n boolean createParents = path.contains(\"-p\");\n path = path.replace(\"-p\", \"\").trim();\n \n if (fs.mkdir(path, createParents)) {\n System.out.println(\"Directory created: \" + path);\n } else {\n System.out.println(\"Directory already exists: \" + path);\n }\n }\n \n private void handleTouch(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: touch <path>\");\n return;\n }\n \n if (fs.createFile(path)) {\n System.out.println(\"File created: \" + path);\n } else {\n System.out.println(\"File already exists: \" + path);\n }\n }\n \n private void handleLs(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n path = \".\";\n }\n \n List<String> contents = fs.ls(path);\n for (String item : contents) {\n System.out.println(item);\n }\n }\n \n private void handleLl(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n path = \".\";\n }\n \n List<FileStat> stats = fs.lsDetailed(path);\n for (FileStat stat : stats) {\n System.out.println(stat.toCompactString());\n }\n }\n \n private void handleCat(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: cat <path>\");\n return;\n }\n \n String content = fs.read(path);\n System.out.println(content);\n }\n \n private void handleEcho(String args) {\n // Format: echo \"content\" > file or echo \"content\" >> file\n if (!args.contains(\">\")) {\n System.out.println(args);\n return;\n }\n \n boolean append = args.contains(\">>\");\n String[] parts = args.split(append ? \">>\" : \">\", 2);\n \n if (parts.length != 2) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: echo \\\"content\\\" > file or echo \\\"content\\\" >> file\");\n return;\n }\n \n String content = parts[0].trim().replaceAll(\"^\\\"|\\\"$\", \"\");\n String path = parts[1].trim();\n \n fs.write(path, content, append);\n System.out.println(\"Content written to: \" + path);\n }\n \n private void handleWrite(String args) {\n String[] parts = args.split(\"\\\\s+\", 2);\n if (parts.length != 2) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: write <path> <content>\");\n return;\n }\n \n fs.write(parts[0], parts[1], false);\n System.out.println(\"Content written to: \" + parts[0]);\n }\n \n private void handleAppend(String args) {\n String[] parts = args.split(\"\\\\s+\", 2);\n if (parts.length != 2) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: append <path> <content>\");\n return;\n }\n \n fs.append(parts[0], parts[1]);\n System.out.println(\"Content appended to: \" + parts[0]);\n }\n \n private void handleMv(String args) {\n String[] parts = args.split(\"\\\\s+\");\n if (parts.length != 2) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: mv <source> <destination>\");\n return;\n }\n \n fs.move(parts[0], parts[1]);\n System.out.println(\"Moved: \" + parts[0] + \" -> \" + parts[1]);\n }\n \n private void handleRm(String args) {\n if (args.isEmpty()) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: rm <path> [-r]\");\n return;\n }\n \n boolean recursive = args.contains(\"-r\");\n String path = args.replace(\"-r\", \"\").trim();\n \n if (fs.delete(path, recursive)) {\n System.out.println(\"Deleted: \" + path);\n } else {\n System.out.println(\"Not found: \" + path);\n }\n }\n \n private void handleCd(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n path = \"/\";\n }\n \n fs.changeDirectory(path);\n }\n \n private void handlePwd() {\n System.out.println(fs.getCurrentWorkingDirectory());\n }\n \n private void handleStat(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: stat <path>\");\n return;\n }\n \n FileStat stat = fs.stat(path);\n System.out.println(stat);\n }\n \n private void handleChmod(String args) {\n String[] parts = args.split(\"\\\\s+\");\n if (parts.length != 2) {\n System.out.println(\"Usage: chmod <mode> <path>\");\n System.out.println(\"Example: chmod 755 /home/file.txt\");\n return;\n }\n \n try {\n int mode = Integer.parseInt(parts[0], 8);\n Permission perm = new Permission(mode);\n fs.setPermission(parts[1], perm);\n System.out.println(\"Permissions changed: \" + parts[1] + \" -> \" + perm);\n } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n System.out.println(\"Invalid mode: \" + parts[0]);\n }\n }\n \n private void handleTree(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n path = \".\";\n }\n \n System.out.println(fs.tree(path));\n }\n \n private void handleDu(String path) {\n if (path.isEmpty()) {\n path = \".\";\n }\n \n long size = fs.getSize(path);\n System.out.println(size + \" bytes\\t\" + path);\n }\n \n private void printHelp() {\n System.out.println(\"\\nAvailable Commands:\");\n System.out.println(\" mkdir <path> [-p] - Create directory (-p for parents)\");\n System.out.println(\" touch <path> - Create empty file\");\n ## 2. Current Work:

I have been implementing a comprehensive in-memory file system module (`file-system-lld`) with the following progress:

**Completed:**

**Current Issue:**
Running `mvn test` resulted in 2 test failures out of 38 tests:
1. `testEmptyPath` (line 511): Expected IllegalArgumentException for `fs.mkdir("")` but nothing was thrown
2. `testPreventRootTraversal` (line 301): Expected IllegalArgumentException for `fs.mkdir("/../etc")` but nothing was thrown

The PathResolver.normalize() method already has validation for empty paths (throws IllegalArgumentException), but it appears the FileSystem class may not be calling normalize() for all operations, or there's a path resolution issue.

## 3. Key Technical Concepts:

- **Composite Pattern**: FileSystemNode as abstract base, Directory (composite) and File (leaf) as concrete implementations
- **Visitor Pattern**: For tree traversal operations (SizeCalculatorVisitor, PermissionUpdaterVisitor)
- **Thread Safety**: ReentrantReadWriteLock per path with consistent lock ordering (sorted paths) to prevent deadlocks
- **Path Resolution**: Normalization of paths with `.` (current dir) and `..` (parent dir), prevention of traversal beyond root
- **Permission System**: Unix-style octal permissions (e.g., 0644, 0755) with read/write/execute bits
- **Atomic Operations**: Move/rename operations use multiple locks acquired in sorted order
- **ConcurrentHashMap**: Used in Directory for thread-safe child storage
- **PathLockManager**: Manages per-path read-write locks with deadlock prevention via sorted lock acquisition
- **Template Method Pattern**: Lock acquisition templates (withReadLock, withWriteLock, withWriteLocks)
- **Strategy Pattern**: Different write modes (append vs overwrite)
